summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduling an in-person pretrial conference for the Ghislaine Maxwell case on November 1, 2021, and detailing COVID-19 protocols and public access arrangements for the hearing at the Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse in New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this pretrial conference is being scheduled.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, scheduling the pretrial conference and outlining the procedures for the hearing.

events.title: In-person pretrial conference
events.description: A scheduled pretrial conference in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, to be held in Courtroom 518.

locations: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York
40 Foley Square, New York, New York
keyFacts: A pretrial conference in the Ghislaine Maxwell case was scheduled for November 1, 2021, at 11:00 a.m.
The conference was to be held in person at the Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse in New York, with specific COVID-19 protocols in place.
Access was to be provided for alleged victims and members of the defendant's family, with public access via overflow courtrooms with live video/audio feeds.
The order references prior court orders (Dkt. Nos. 330 and 344) regarding victim/family access and scheduling.
